DemoDays

Student demos at the intersection of art, design and code.

Event

  • 11/10/2012

    • Saturday

  • 2:30-5:00

  • Event

November 2012

Archival Content • Submit correction

The November 2012 DemoDays was held on 11/10/2012 at Pivotal Labs in New York City.

Join us next time!

DemoDays is a monthly student-run event in NYC, organized by tech@NYU, Parsons Code Club, Create@Cooper and Columbia ADI. We're all about fostering a community of students who create things. We want to provide a platform for student builders to present their work, to celebrate their creations, and let that inspire other students to build projects they care about.

    SIGN UP

  • Wanna hang out?

Speaker

Jer Thorp

Jer Thorp is an artist and educator from Vancouver, Canada, currently living in New York. Coming from a background in genetics, his digital art practice explores the many-folded boundaries between science, data, art, and culture. Recently, his work has been featured by The Guardian, Scientific American, The New Yorker, and Popular Science.

DemoDays

tech@NYU in conjunction with create@cooper, NYU Poly EIA, and Major League Hacking
